abstract.text: A property wrapper that notifies the system that a property value change has invalidated an aspect of the containing view.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use this wrapper when a change in the property value invalidates the display, layout, configuration, constraints, or intrinsic sizing of a view. This wrapper performs any actions necessary to notify the system that your view is invalid and requires an update. The actions depend on the invalidation types you specify. For more information on available invalidation types, see
When you change the badge color, the property wrapper calls
, causing the system to redraw the view. When you change the badge position, the property wrapper also calls
, causing the system to update the view’s subviews before it redraws.

perform changes on the next update cycle. You can make changes to multiple properties and views before any of those views update. Consolidating the updates to one update cycle is usually better for performance.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An object that manages the content for a rectangular area on the screen.
A property wrapper that notifies the system that a property value change has invalidated an aspect of the containing view.

Marks the receiver’s entire bounds rectangle as needing to be redrawn.
Invalidates the current layout of the receiver and triggers a layout update during the next update cycle.
Implements a type of invalidation that can occur on a view that requires an update.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
